removals.reasoning: Extra parentheses around a cast expression used as a function argument are redundant.

Both casts and the surrounding parentheses are unnecessary; free accepts void*, and A is already a pointer.
Parentheses around the array index expression are unnecessary; operator precedence already yields the intended result.
Parentheses around a single variable as a cast operand are unnecessary.
Parentheses grouping the product are redundant; * has higher precedence than + and the surrounding division/assignment.
Parentheses around a single variable as a cast operand are unnecessary.
Addition and subtraction are left-associative; these parentheses do not affect evaluation.
